BackstoryDef.Name: CFAR_Infantry
BackstoryDef.title: Infantry
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] survived [PAWN_possessive] first deployment when an artillery barrage buried the trench and the squad dug out by hand. [PAWN_pronoun] doesn’t talk much now — just watches the skies and checks cover twice.

[PAWN_nameDef] misunderstood “suppressive fire” as “nonstop fire” for weeks. It somehow worked. [PAWN_pronoun] has since become the squad’s go-to for chaotic breakthroughs. The Imperial Navy calls it aggression; [PAWN_pronoun] calls it habit.

[PAWN_nameDef] once tripped over a power cable mid-charge and discharged [PAWN_possessive] pulse carbine into the sky. It scared off a recon drone. Since then, [PAWN_pronoun] acts like it was planned. The squad lets it slide.

[PAWN_nameDef] learned to calibrate [PAWN_possessive] pulse rifle by trial, error, and a misfire into a sergeant’s locker. Shoots well now, even under pressure. Keeps quiet, keeps sharp, keeps the weapon clean.
[PAWN_nameDef] made the mistake of insulting the cook sergeant’s seasoning once. Got triple-spiced stew for a week. Since then, [PAWN_pronoun] eats in silence and never complains — just sweats.

[PAWN_nameDef] argued daily with the squad tech over pulse calibration settings — until [PAWN_possessive] rifle overheated mid-firefight. Since then, [PAWN_pronoun] cleans the coils religiously and grumbles only half as much.

[PAWN_nameDef] nearly came to blows with a bunkmate over swapped rifle parts. The sergeant settled it by making both clean every weapon in the squad. [PAWN_pronoun] never mixes up rifles now — or shares tools.

[PAWN_nameDef] doesn’t say much, but everyone in the squad listens when [PAWN_pronoun] speaks. [PAWN_pronoun] remembers names, shares rations, and knows who’s short a charge pack. Trust isn’t shouted — it’s built.
[PAWN_nameDef] slipped on a trench ladder and landed boots-first on a charging megaspider. It fled. The squad called it “tactical stomping” for weeks. [PAWN_pronoun] never confirmed or denied it.

[PAWN_nameDef] tripped during a sprint and skidded into a spelopede nest, [PAWN_possessive] rifle firing wildly. One hit. The rest fled. [PAWN_pronoun] calls it reflex; command called it lucky. Either way, [PAWN_pronoun] lived.

[PAWN_nameDef] refuses shortcuts, refuses excuses. [PAWN_pronoun] cleans [PAWN_possessive] kit by regulation and holds the line with quiet resolve. For [PAWN_pronoun], honor isn’t pride — it’s the standard.
[PAWN_nameDef] doesn’t brag, doesn’t cut corners, and checks in on rookies without making a show of it. [PAWN_pronoun] sees honor in consistency, not medals.

BackstoryDef.Name: CFAR_Cook
BackstoryDef.title: Culinary specialist
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] can’t measure to save a life. One pinch becomes three, and sauces turn into chemical experiments. Still, [PAWN_pronoun] keeps the kitchen clean and the food moving — mostly forward.
[PAWN_nameDef] thinks recipes are suggestions and seasoning is a contest. [PAWN_pronoun] once added stim-powder instead of salt. The squad didn’t sleep for 30 hours, but morale was excellent.
[PAWN_nameDef] kept the Imperial Navy running, one hot meal at a time. [PAWN_pronoun] wasn’t much of a shot, but [PAWN_pronoun] was famous for bonking knuckleheads with [PAWN_possessive] ladle.

[PAWN_nameDef] tried to replicate field rations with local fauna and too much vinegar. The result was... unique, but no one got sick. [PAWN_pronoun] claims it’s flavor innovation. The squad just shrugs and eats.

[PAWN_nameDef] joined as a cook and stayed near the front line for “quality control.” [PAWN_pronoun] samples everything — twice — and adjusts seasoning to personal taste, which leans heavy and rich. Despite this, [PAWN_pronoun] keeps the meals balanced, clean, and oddly popular.

BackstoryDef.Name: CFAR_NCOInfantry
BackstoryDef.title: Infantry sergeant
BackstoryDef.description: Sergeant [PAWN_nameDef] fought in every dust-covered trench and heat-scoured canyon the Imperial Navy forgot to name. [PAWN_pronoun] trusts old instincts more than fresh orders and keeps the squad alive through habit and spite.
The front line was messy, but sergeant [PAWN_nameDef] was messier. [PAWN_pronoun] fought with grit, barked orders like cannon fire, and dragged victories out of battlefields that should’ve been lost.

Sergeant [PAWN_nameDef] doesn’t bother with formalities. [PAWN_pronoun] trains rookies by shoving them into drills until they stop bleeding. When [PAWN_pronoun] says “cover,” it means now — or never again.
Sergeant [PAWN_nameDef] keeps a spare battery, a spare plan, and a spare boot for throwing. [PAWN_pronoun] doesn’t believe in luck — just loaded rifles and covered flanks.

Sergeant [PAWN_nameDef] once held a breach with a broken carbine and bad attitude. Now [PAWN_pronoun] drills discipline through repetition and glare. The squad listens, or they run laps until sunrise.

Sergeant [PAWN_nameDef] lost count of deployments but remembers every trooper buried. [PAWN_pronoun] keeps the squad tight, the gear tighter, and emotions buried deeper. Orders are short, meals are hot, and mistakes are paid in sweat.

BackstoryDef.Name: CFAR_COfficerInfantry
BackstoryDef.title: Infantry officer
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] studied logistics, formations, and battlefield tempo. [PAWN_pronoun] now spends most days redirecting soldiers who “creatively interpret” orders. Somehow, they succeed — and [PAWN_pronoun] gets the headache.

[PAWN_nameDef] memorized doctrine to the letter. [PAWN_pronoun] now leads troops who ignore it in favor of improvised trench charges and spontaneous flanking. [PAWN_possessive] migraine is permanent, like their loyalty.

[PAWN_nameDef] graduated with top marks in tactical doctrine, then deployed to a unit that communicates via shouting and gestures. [PAWN_pronoun] now plans operations with one hand and rubs [PAWN_possessive] temple with the other.

[PAWN_nameDef] writes clear orders, delivers them calmly, and watches them get executed in the wrong order — with success. [PAWN_pronoun] no longer questions it. [PAWN_pronoun] just drinks water, breathes deep, and adjusts the plan.

[PAWN_nameDef] was promised structured deployments. Instead, [PAWN_pronoun] herds loud, impulsive soldiers through broken radios, ammo shortages, and miracle victories. [PAWN_pronoun] calls it leadership. Others call it survival.

[PAWN_nameDef] trained for textbook engagements. Instead, [PAWN_pronoun] commands a squad that weaponizes chaos and survives by accident. [PAWN_pronoun] updates the mission board, deletes it, then updates it again.

BackstoryDef.Name: CFAR_COfficerInfantry_N
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] was groomed for command with formality and theory — polished speeches, precise tactics, flawless posture. [PAWN_pronoun] now leads soldiers who skip polish for duct tape and volume. [PAWN_pronoun] maintains composure, but the sighs are getting longer.

[PAWN_nameDef] assumed authority came with silence and obedience. [PAWN_pronoun] found that orders need shouting, repetition, and sometimes interpretive threats. [PAWN_pronoun] adapts — awkwardly, but effectively.
[PAWN_nameDef] believed battle was a chessboard. Then [PAWN_pronoun] met soldiers who use pulse rifles as shovels and eat rations raw. [PAWN_pronoun] now plans around behavior, not strategy.
[PAWN_nameDef] once practiced speeches in front of mirrors. Now [PAWN_pronoun] gives orders while dodging friendly fire and yelling over loud music. The uniform stays pressed; the patience does not.

BackstoryDef.Name: CFAR_FOfficerInfantry
BackstoryDef.title: Infantry officer
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] earned every stripe managing troops who turned drills into brawls and patrols into bar fights. Now [PAWN_pronoun] delegates with precision, watches the chaos from above, and files reports with the door locked.
[PAWN_nameDef] used to shout orders across trenches. Now [PAWN_pronoun] signs requisitions, issues strategic commands, and fends off migraines caused by junior officers making familiar mistakes.

[PAWN_nameDef] once chased disobedient soldiers through crossfire. Now [PAWN_pronoun] chases funding allocations, writes doctrine, and occasionally reminds field units to stop “tactically improvising.”

[PAWN_nameDef] once led disorganized squads through smoke and shouting. Now [PAWN_pronoun] leads through paperwork, planning, and caffeine. The field taught [PAWN_pronoun] one thing: always double-check the comms team.

BackstoryDef.Name: CFAR_FOfficerInfantry_N
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] once believed war was honor and procession. Reality replaced that with triage reports and logistics failures. Now [PAWN_pronoun] commands firmly, speaks carefully, and respects the unpredictable loyalty of the common ranks.

[PAWN_nameDef] entered war with lineage and theory. Years of commanding unpredictable troopers taught [PAWN_pronoun] the value of redundancy — in plans and aspirin. Now [PAWN_pronoun] rules from a polished desk with a locked liquor drawer.

[PAWN_nameDef] grew into command by surviving command. The noble accent remains, but the patience has thinned. [PAWN_pronoun] leads with elegance, tolerates madness, and signs orders that always come with a margin for chaos.

[PAWN_nameDef] was raised to command and humbled by experience. [PAWN_pronoun] now coordinates offensives with poise — and drafts contingency plans in triplicate. [PAWN_pronoun] trusts instinct, but always confirms with intel.
